title: Moral Money episode 8: Matt on flying business class and charging your kids rent
text:
Front page cartoonist Matt has guided Telegraph readers through 31 years of general elections, market crashes, sporting finals and more. Now, he turns his mind to moral money.

Prince Philip called Matt a “genius”, Theresa May had one of his cartoons in her office in Downing Street and in 2002 he was appointed an MBE. A colleague once wrote about him that, much like pop stars and Brazilian footballers, he is known by only one name.

So what does he have to say about this week's problems?

In the final episode of the podcast's first series, father-of-four Matt Pritchett discusses two child-rearing dilemmas that will no doubt feel familiar to many of his regular audience.

Is it wrong to fly business...
description: Front page cartoonist Matt has guided Telegraph readers through 31 years of general elections, market crashes, sporting finals and more.
